intro: Randia caudata, commonly known as the trailing randia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that are often followed by red, fleshy berries. Randia caudata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique fruit.
